algorithms.curves

Class GEVChiSquareMinimization

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.curves.AbstractCurveFitter
      • algorithms.curves.GEVChiSquareMinimization
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICurveFitter

    public class GEVChiSquareMinimization
extends AbstractCurveFitter
      A chi square minimization routine for the Generalized Extreme Value function.
  It has been tailored for use with the two-point correlation algorithm,
  that is for k > 0.

  If one knows the range of parameter space for k and sigma, it is better to
  use methods which calculate the fit with that better knowledge.

  mu is  the location parameter
  sigma is the scale parameter and is > 0
  k is the shape parameter

                           (   (      ( x-mu))-(1/k))
                           (-1*(1 + k*(-----))      )
                  1        (   (      (sigma))      )   (      ( x-mu))(-1-(1/k))
  y = y_const * ----- * exp                           * (1 + k*(-----))
                sigma                                   (      (sigma))
    Author:
    nichole

    • Method Detail

      • fitCurveKGreaterThanZero

        public GEVYFit fitCurveKGreaterThanZero(GEVChiSquareMinimization.WEIGHTS_DURING_CHISQSUM weightMethod)
                                 throws FailedToConvergeException,
                                        java.io.IOException
              Fit the curve using a simple constraint for mu and a narrow range of possible values
      for k and sigma.

      Mu is usually found to be the maximum of the y array of the data because the
      code is intended to be used on GEV distributions, more specifically, those of
      EV Type I and Type II with k > 0.


      The initial k range is 0.001f to 10.f
      and the initial sigma range is kMin * x[0] to kMax * x[x.length - 1];

      The method uses one iteration of a downhill simplex method for fitting.
        Specified by:
        fitCurveKGreaterThanZero in interface ICurveFitter
        Specified by:
        fitCurveKGreaterThanZero in class AbstractCurveFitter
        Parameters:
        weightMethod - the method for determining the tolerance of fit to a point. the errors weight is the best choice if errors are available.
        Returns:
        yfit the best fitting curve
        Throws:
        FailedToConvergeException
        java.io.IOException

      • fitCurveKGreaterThanZero

        public GEVYFit fitCurveKGreaterThanZero(GEVChiSquareMinimization.WEIGHTS_DURING_CHISQSUM weightMethod,
                               float mu,
                               float yNorm)
                                 throws FailedToConvergeException,
                                        java.io.IOException
              Fit the curve using a simple constraint for mu and a narrow range of possible values
      for k and sigma.

      Mu is usually found to be the maximum of the y array of the data because the
      code is intended to be used on GEV distributions, more specifically, those of
      EV Type I and Type II with k > 0.

      The initial k range is 0.001f to 10.f
      and the initial sigma range is kMin * x[0] to kMax * x[x.length - 1];

      The method uses one iteration of a downhill simplex method for fitting.
        Parameters:
        weightMethod - the method for determining the tolerance of fit to a point. the errors weight is the best choice if errors are available.
        mu -
        yNorm -
        Returns:
        yfit the best fitting curve
        Throws:

                                                   throws FailedToConvergeException,
                                                          java.io.IOException
              Fit the curve using a simple constraint for mu and a narrow range of possible values
      for k and sigma.

      Mu is usually found to be the maximum of the y array of the data because the
      code is intended to be used on GEV distributions, more specifically, those of
      EV Type I and Type II with k > 0.

      The initial k range is 0.001f to 10.f
      and the initial sigma range is kMin * x[0] to kMax * x[x.length - 1];

      The method uses one iteration of a downhill simplex method for fitting.
        Parameters:
        weightMethod - the method for determining the tolerance of fit to a point. the errors weight is the best choice if errors are available.
        mu -
        yNorm -
        Returns:
        yfit the best fitting curve
        Throws:

      • fitCurveKGreaterThanZeroAndMu

        public GEVYFit fitCurveKGreaterThanZeroAndMu(GEVChiSquareMinimization.WEIGHTS_DURING_CHISQSUM weightMethod)
                                      throws FailedToConvergeException,
                                             java.io.IOException
              Fit curve within range of given parameters.  Internally, uses the Neder-Meade downhill
      simplex method and ranges of k, sigma and mu.  If the best fitting chi-square statistic
      is larger than 100, it repeats the process using different start conditions for
      the simplex method and keeps the best result.
        Parameters:
        weightMethod - the method for determining the tolerance of fit to a point. the errors weight is the best choice if errors are available.
        Returns:
        yfit the best fitting curve
        Throws:
        FailedToConvergeException
        java.io.IOException

      • fitCurveKGreaterThanZeroAndMu

        public GEVYFit fitCurveKGreaterThanZeroAndMu(GEVChiSquareMinimization.WEIGHTS_DURING_CHISQSUM weightMethod,
                                    float kMin,
                                    float kMax,
                                    float sigmaMin,
                                    float sigmaMax)
                                      throws FailedToConvergeException,
                                             java.io.IOException
             Fit curve within range of given parameters.  Internally, uses the Neder-Meade downhill
     simplex method and no additional iterations combined with range reduction such as
      is used by the fitCurveKGreaterThanZero method without min and max arguments.

      The mu parameter is fit for x[0] through x[yConstIndex] only.
        Parameters:
        weightMethod - the method for determining the tolerance of fit to a point. the errors weight is the best choice if errors are available.
        kMin -
        kMax -
        sigmaMin -
        sigmaMax -
        Returns:
        yfit the best fitting curve
        Throws:
        FailedToConvergeException
        java.io.IOException
